roleset.name: to miss, omit or avoid
roleset.note: SKIP-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from skip.01-n)

example.name: skip-v: transitive with a purpose
example.text: [*-1] The son of a physicist , Mr. Hahn skipped first grade because his reading ability was so far above his classmates .
example.arg: because his reading ability was so far above his classmates

example.name: skip-v: transitive
example.text: But [*-1] knowing that mechanics would probably ground him for repairs , Mr. Brown skipped his stop in nearby Chicago and set course [*-1]to get his load -- a few hundred parcels -- to the Memphis package-sorting hub on time .
example.arg: [*-1] knowing that mechanics would probably ground him for repairs

example.name: skip-v: simply transitive
example.text: One of the best deals , though , may mean [*] skipping Christmas dinner with the relatives .

roleset.name: to move lighly, to jump
roleset.note: SKIP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls run-51.3.2. (from skip.02-v)

example.name: skip-v: not from the corpus
example.text: John was skipping in the playground.

example.name: skip_off-v: with direction
example.text: When their changes are completed, and after they have worked up a sweat , ringers often skip off to the local pub , [*-2] leaving worship for others below .
example.arg: When their changes are completed, and after they have worked up a sweat
